meanings.definition: To be on the edge or border of something.
meanings.sent1: The cat was verging on the table, trying to catch a glimpse of the fishbowl.
meanings.sent2: The hikers were verging on the cliff, admiring the breathtaking view below.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was verging on the bird feeder, hoping for a tasty snack.
meanings.sent4: The sun was verging on the horizon, painting the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The old house was verging on the forest, surrounded by tall trees and chirping birds.

meanings.definition: To approach closely; to be near.
meanings.sent1: The car was verging on the parking spot, looking for a place to stop.
meanings.sent2: The storm was verging on the city, threatening to bring heavy rain and strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The dog was verging on the treat jar, wagging its tail in anticipation.
meanings.sent4: The deadline was verging on the horizon, reminding everyone to finish their tasks on time.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was verging on the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
